I've been on this app for a long time now, and all I can say is that it keeps on getting better! 

Miles better than any other dating app on the market (and I've tried just about all of them). Makes girls message first, which for me means - no harassment, I'm guaranteed that the guys will actually message me, and it's kind of empowering :) from what my guys friends have said they've found they get no bots and the girls they match will actually speak to them rather than ignore! Win win I think!

Also I've just started using the Bumble bff option, which I've found great as someone new to London - since I don't know that many people it's a great way to make new girlfriends and expand a social circle! 

Keep up the amazing work Bumble 😊

For the first few weeks I was amazed by how good looking, intelligent and entrepreneurial all the guys on Bumble were...a way higher standard than Tinder etc. 

But after getting loads of matches and initiating conversations with them, I realised they're almost all fake accounts to lure users in. I almost never get a reply (whereas on Tinder and Happn I have plenty of great conversations that often lead to dates). 

It's a waste of time, and insulting that an app focused on empowering women should actually seek to deceive its users like this.

data.content:
I'm highly suspicious that a lot of your accounts are not "real". Sure, I bet these people exist, but I don't for one second think they are genuine! A) high number of pictures are often too professional - let's face it, most of us mere mortals are rubbish photographers! b) a higher number of "hotter" people than peer apps b) mainly similar professions - business owners, lawyers and directors seem to be represented really well!! d) when I log into VIB there is a sudden change in "personal" to a more normal aura - I.e genuine accounts e) when tinder experienced a "charge" on new year days Bumble was as per normal! 

I am actually quite offended by this approach! It's smoke and mirrors! Do you think people are stupid! I understand you want to avoid having a lack of volume which will result with people losing interest, but this deceitful approach breaks any trust! This is basically the same as bars in Mayfair employing attractive young people to sit in their venues. I thought those business practices were behind, even more so for an app which is designed to empower women! 😂😂😂

The app is a good idea and works. Shame that management elected to deceive their customers though.

data.content:
After reading an article in this Septembers English edition of Elle magazine I came across one of the founders of tinder. Whitney Wolfe is the only female part of the original founders of tinder.

Having use the at myself for the last three months on and off I decided that I would use this new bumble app which was created by Whitney. The idea is to have a more female friendly environment where women do the pursuing.
This sounded more relaxed than Tinder where dies can be quite aggressive and assume every woman is a one night stand.
Not to be arrogant but one of the benefits of tinder is that you don't have to be on the app for more than an hour before you have at least a handful of matches.

I was on bumble for just about 24 hours and nothing not a single match, which has me thinking this is the allure  of tinder is.

Not only do you get an opportunity to see the guys that potentially if you're very busy you wouldn't normally be able to meet or see but it serves as a bit of an ego boost, let's just be honest!

Bumble has the premise of the same thing as Tinder but with no matches it's very confusing to understand what the point of this app is. Reluctantly I am back to Tinder and since registry and again I already have three matches.

Sorry I won't be using bumble it's a pointless app!
